rsbNotes.title: Ps 100
rsbNotes.text: Ps. 100 See 95:1 note.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 100:1
rsbNotes.text: 100:1 all the earth. As in the royal psalms preceding, the call goes out beyond the chosen people to all the peoples of the earth. God is their King too, whether they are aware of it or not.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 100:2
rsbNotes.text: 100:2 with gladness. God is not a despotic king who forces his people to serve him. Loving service is grateful response to the grace of God.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 100:3
rsbNotes.text: 100:3 the sheep of his pasture. See Ps. 23:1 for note on royal overtones of the portrayal of God as a shepherd.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 100:4
rsbNotes.text: 100:4 his gates . . . his courts. Those of the temple. This psalm may have been sung during a festive entry into the temple precincts.

rsbNotes.title: Ps 100:5
rsbNotes.text: 100:5 his steadfast love. God’s lovingkindness to people who are in covenant with Him.
